node.category: What is the way things are?
Should the statutory retirement age remain at 63?
Why should the statutory retirement age remain at 63?

node.surface: Although the workload is getting heavier in many professions
and physical and psychological wear on personnel is steadily increasing,
the statutory retirement age should in the future not remain at 63 years.

node.category: Why should the statutory retirement age be raised?

node.surface: For, due to the low birth rate, the proportion of the elderly population and with it pension costs are on the rise,
and furthermore, due to today's healthcare most people in many occupations are fitter for work in old age than before.
